Ingredients: 

• 5 ripe avocados 
• 1-2 cloves of garlic, minced (adjust to your taste) 
• 1-2 fresh jalapeño peppers, seeded and minced (adjust to your spice preference) 
• 1 small red onion, finely chopped 
• 2-3 ripe tomatoes, diced 
• 1/4 cup fresh cilantro leaves, chopped 
• Juice of 2-3 limes 
• Salt and pepper to taste 

Procedure: 

1. Cut the avocados in half, remove the pits, and scoop the flesh into a mixing bowl. 
2. Use a fork or potato masher to mash the avocado to your desired consistency. Some people like it chunky, while others prefer it smoother. You can leave some chunks for texture. 
3. Add the minced garlic and finely chopped jalapeño peppers to the mashed avocados. Adjust the amount of garlic and jalapeño based on your taste preferences. If you want a milder guacamole, you can omit the seeds and ribs of the jalapeño peppers. 
4. Stir in the diced red onion, chopped cilantro, and diced tomatoes. Mix all the ingredients well. 
5. Squeeze the juice of 2-3 limes into the mixture. Lime juice not only adds flavor but also helps prevent the avocados from turning brown. 
6. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Start with a little salt and pepper and add more if needed. 
7. Taste the guacamole and adjust the ingredients to your liking. You can add more lime juice, jalapeño, or salt if necessary. 
8. Cover the guacamole with plastic wrap, making sure it's in direct contact with the surface to prevent browning, and refrigerate until ready to serve. 


Serve your homemade guacamole with tortilla chips, tacos, nachos, or as a dip for vegetables. Enjoy!
